title: Chinese ambassador to Cote d’Ivoire donates office supplies to National Professional Journalists Organization
description: On February 28, 2018, Tang Weibin, the ambassador to Côte d’Ivoire, attended the annual meeting of the Côte d’Ivoire National Organization of Professional Journalists and delivered a keynote speech on “China-Cote d’Ivoire Relations and News Media”. At the ceremony, Ambassador Tang donated office supplies, such as TV sets, to the organization. Representative of the Minister of Information Baraya, Marcory Mayor Abi, President of the National Association of Professional Journalists Yihuo, and about 70 local media professionals attended the event. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese ambassador to Cote d’Ivoire donates office supplies to National Professional Journalists Organization

# Description
On February 28, 2018, Tang Weibin, the ambassador to Côte d’Ivoire, attended the annual meeting of the Côte d’Ivoire National Organization of Professional Journalists and delivered a keynote speech on “China-Cote d’Ivoire Relations and News Media”. At the ceremony, Ambassador Tang donated office supplies, such as TV sets, to the organization. Representative of the Minister of Information Baraya, Marcory Mayor Abi, President of the National Association of Professional Journalists Yihuo, and about 70 local media professionals attended the event. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.
justification: Donation of office supplies to a professional organization with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of office supplies (TV sets) to National Professional Journalists Organization, no energy-related components

title: China hosts 15 law enforcement officers from Cote d’Ivoire for training
description: On June 13, 2018, Ambassador Tang Weibin in Côte d’Ivoire held a farewell reception at the embassy for the study and training of 15 law enforcement officers in China. Director of the Office of the Ministry of the Interior, Chief of Police, Director of the Department of International Cooperation of the Ministry of Culture, and Acting Director of the Department of Asia-Pacific Affairs of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs attended the reception. The program length and value are not known.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Title
China hosts 15 law enforcement officers from Cote d’Ivoire for training

# Description
On June 13, 2018, Ambassador Tang Weibin in Côte d’Ivoire held a farewell reception at the embassy for the study and training of 15 law enforcement officers in China. Director of the Office of the Ministry of the Interior, Chief of Police, Director of the Department of International Cooperation of the Ministry of Culture, and Acting Director of the Department of Asia-Pacific Affairs of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs attended the reception. The program length and value are not known.
justification: Project involves training for law enforcement officers, which is unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Training program for 15 law enforcement officers, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: Chinese Embassy donates a batch of agricultural machinery to Cote d’Ivoire citizens
description: On November 15, 2018, Tang Weibin, the ambassador to Côte d’Ivoire, attended the 22nd Côte d’Ivoire “National Day of Peace” celebrations in Dabou. He delivered a speech and donated a batch of agricultural machinery to residents at the celebration, including an agricultural tricycle. Kone, Minister of Scientific Unity, Social Integration and Poverty Alleviation, Essy, Secretary of State for the Promotion of Private Investment in the Prime Minister's Office, Cisse, UNDP Representative in Cote d'Ivoire, and others attended the celebration. The value of the donation is not known.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates a batch of agricultural machinery to Cote d’Ivoire citizens

# Description
On November 15, 2018, Tang Weibin, the ambassador to Côte d’Ivoire, attended the 22nd Côte d’Ivoire “National Day of Peace” celebrations in Dabou. He delivered a speech and donated a batch of agricultural machinery to residents at the celebration, including an agricultural tricycle. Kone, Minister of Scientific Unity, Social Integration and Poverty Alleviation, Essy, Secretary of State for the Promotion of Private Investment in the Prime Minister's Office, Cisse, UNDP Representative in Cote d'Ivoire, and others attended the celebration. The value of the donation is not known.
justification: Project involves donation of agricultural machinery for social development purposes, with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of agricultural machinery, social development context, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese Embassy donates disaster relief to villagers in Dabakala, Côte d’Ivoire
description: On July 7, 2018, Ambassador Tang Weibin in Côte d’Ivoire was invited to attend the tribute ceremony to President Ouattara held by Prime Minister Coulibaly of Côte d’Ivoire in Dabakala. At the ceremony, Ambassador Tang handed over a small number of donations for disaster relief to the rural areas of Dabakala to help local villagers rebuild their homes after floods. The value of the donation is not known.
combined_text:
# Sector
RECONSTRUCTION RELIEF AND REHABILITATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates disaster relief to villagers in Dabakala, Côte d’Ivoire

# Description
On July 7, 2018, Ambassador Tang Weibin in Côte d’Ivoire was invited to attend the tribute ceremony to President Ouattara held by Prime Minister Coulibaly of Côte d’Ivoire in Dabakala. At the ceremony, Ambassador Tang handed over a small number of donations for disaster relief to the rural areas of Dabakala to help local villagers rebuild their homes after floods. The value of the donation is not known.
justification: Project involves disaster relief donations for rebuilding homes, with no direct energy or environmental impact
evidence: Disaster relief donations, rebuilding homes after floods, social development focus

title: China sponsors the establishment of Luban Workshop in Cote d’Ivoire
description: At the 2018 Beijing Summit of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation in early September 2018, China pledged to establish 10 Luban workshops in Africa to teach vocational skills to youth people, one of which will be established in Cote d’Ivoire. On September 27, 2019, Wan Li, Chinese Ambassador to Côte d'Ivoire, met with Zheng Qingchun, Vice President of Tianjin University of Technology, who came to Cote d'Ivoire for inspection, and exchanged views on the establishment of Luban Workshop at the Institut National Polytechnique Félix Houphouët-Boigny (亚穆苏克罗国立博瓦尼理工学院). Tianjin University of Technology will corporate with Institut National Polytechnique Félix Houphouët-Boigny in the construction of the workshop.   On December 9, 2020, the unveiling ceremony of the Luban Workshop was held online. It covers an area of 805 sqr meters. It has a large equipment workshop (training venue), 3 laboratories, 3 experimental teaching and learning classrooms, 1 teaching and research room, and is equipped with 11 sets of 5 types of large-scale equipment, and 87 sets of 16 types of small instruments and equipment, as well as auxiliary teaching equipment such as experimental benches and projectors. The Cote d'Ivoire Luban workshop became the fourth Luban workshop to be unveiled in Africa within half a month.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China sponsors the establishment of Luban Workshop in Cote d’Ivoire

# Description
At the 2018 Beijing Summit of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation in early September 2018, China pledged to establish 10 Luban workshops in Africa to teach vocational skills to youth people, one of which will be established in Cote d’Ivoire. On September 27, 2019, Wan Li, Chinese Ambassador to Côte d'Ivoire, met with Zheng Qingchun, Vice President of Tianjin University of Technology, who came to Cote d'Ivoire for inspection, and exchanged views on the establishment of Luban Workshop at the Institut National Polytechnique Félix Houphouët-Boigny (亚穆苏克罗国立博瓦尼理工学院). Tianjin University of Technology will corporate with Institut National Polytechnique Félix Houphouët-Boigny in the construction of the workshop.   On December 9, 2020, the unveiling ceremony of the Luban Workshop was held online. It covers an area of 805 sqr meters. It has a large equipment workshop (training venue), 3 laboratories, 3 experimental teaching and learning classrooms, 1 teaching and research room, and is equipped with 11 sets of 5 types of large-scale equipment, and 87 sets of 16 types of small instruments and equipment, as well as auxiliary teaching equipment such as experimental benches and projectors. The Cote d'Ivoire Luban workshop became the fourth Luban workshop to be unveiled in Africa within half a month.
justification: Project focuses on vocational education and skill development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Luban Workshop for vocational skills training, educational facilities and equipment

title: Chinese Embassy in Côte d’Ivoire donates agricultural machinery to the Prime Minister
description: From December 6 to 9, 2018, at the invitation of the Chairman of Ivory Coast Region and Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research Marbury, Ambassador Tang Weibin attended the second Nihidaley Economic and Trade Cultural Festival in the region as a special guest. At the official ceremony of the Nihidaley Economic, Trade and Cultural Festival on December 8, Ambassador Tang donated a batch of agricultural machinery to Prime Minister Coulibaly and Minister Marbury on behalf of the embassy. The value of the donation is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Embassy in Côte d’Ivoire donates agricultural machinery to the Prime Minister

# Description
From December 6 to 9, 2018, at the invitation of the Chairman of Ivory Coast Region and Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research Marbury, Ambassador Tang Weibin attended the second Nihidaley Economic and Trade Cultural Festival in the region as a special guest. At the official ceremony of the Nihidaley Economic, Trade and Cultural Festival on December 8, Ambassador Tang donated a batch of agricultural machinery to Prime Minister Coulibaly and Minister Marbury on behalf of the embassy. The value of the donation is unknown.
justification: Donation of agricultural machinery is a social development initiative with no clear environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Agricultural machinery donation, no specific environmental or energy-related components mentioned

title: China provides 2.1 million RMB grant to Cote d’Ivoire for the provision of anti-malarial assistance (Linked to Project ID#87822)
description: On March 15, 2018, Tang Weibin, the ambassador to Côte d’Ivoire, and the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Côte d’Ivoire, Marcel Amon-Tano, signed two intergovernmental assistance agreements between China and Côte d’Ivoire. One of these agreements was an Exchange of Notes regarding the provision of 2.1 million RMB worth of material assistance by the Chinese government to the National Anti-malarial Research Center of Côte d’Ivoire. According to the exchange, the Chinese government will provide a batch of office and laboratory equipment to the Anti-malarial Center of Cote d’Ivoire, and actively discuss with the department to assist in the construction of a general hospital to effectively improve the medical and health conditions of the department.   The other agreement signed at this ceremony, an agricultural ETCA, is coded in Project ID#87822.  These agreements are the result of "One of the results of the implementation of the Ten Major Plans for China-Africa Cooperation”.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China provides 2.1 million RMB grant to Cote d’Ivoire for the provision of anti-malarial assistance (Linked to Project ID#87822)

# Description
On March 15, 2018, Tang Weibin, the ambassador to Côte d’Ivoire, and the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Côte d’Ivoire, Marcel Amon-Tano, signed two intergovernmental assistance agreements between China and Côte d’Ivoire. One of these agreements was an Exchange of Notes regarding the provision of 2.1 million RMB worth of material assistance by the Chinese government to the National Anti-malarial Research Center of Côte d’Ivoire. According to the exchange, the Chinese government will provide a batch of office and laboratory equipment to the Anti-malarial Center of Cote d’Ivoire, and actively discuss with the department to assist in the construction of a general hospital to effectively improve the medical and health conditions of the department.   The other agreement signed at this ceremony, an agricultural ETCA, is coded in Project ID#87822.  These agreements are the result of "One of the results of the implementation of the Ten Major Plans for China-Africa Cooperation”.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare assistance and infrastructure development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Provision of anti-malarial assistance, medical equipment, and discussion of hospital construction

title: CGCOC group and the Cotton and Cashew Council sign agreement for financing cashew production supplies
description: On November 3, 2018, an agreement was signed between the CGCOC group and the Cote d'Ivoire Cotton and Cashew Council (CCA) on the export directly to China of 100,000 tonnes of cashew. This agreement also covers the supply of cotton and cashew producers with fertilizers, as well as the financing of the acquisition of processing equipment by CGCOC. The value of the fertilizer supplied and the amount of financing for the acquisition of the equipment is not known.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
CGCOC group and the Cotton and Cashew Council sign agreement for financing cashew production supplies

# Description
On November 3, 2018, an agreement was signed between the CGCOC group and the Cote d'Ivoire Cotton and Cashew Council (CCA) on the export directly to China of 100,000 tonnes of cashew. This agreement also covers the supply of cotton and cashew producers with fertilizers, as well as the financing of the acquisition of processing equipment by CGCOC. The value of the fertilizer supplied and the amount of financing for the acquisition of the equipment is not known.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural production and processing equipment without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Cashew and cotton production, fertilizer supply, processing equipment financing

title: China agrees to build Chinese Cultural Center in Abidjan
description: According to the Chinese Embassy, in August 2018, the Chinese government and the Cote d'Ivoire government signed an agreement on the mutual establishment of cultural centers. On June 24, 2019, the Chinese cultural center will be established in Abidjan, and the space for the construction of the center has already been identified as announced by the Ambassador of the People's Republic of China to Côte d'Ivoire, Wan Li, during a meeting with the press at the premises of the Chinese Chancellery in Abidjan. The cultural center will be a "platform" to bring the Ivorian and Chinese people "to know each other better, to understand each other" in order to strengthen cooperation between the two countries.  On July 27, 2020, the project was reviewed by the Cote d'Ivoire Minister Raymonde Goudou-Coffie and Chinese Ambassador Wan Li. As of this date, no additional information can be found on the implementation status of the project.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China agrees to build Chinese Cultural Center in Abidjan

# Description
According to the Chinese Embassy, in August 2018, the Chinese government and the Cote d'Ivoire government signed an agreement on the mutual establishment of cultural centers. On June 24, 2019, the Chinese cultural center will be established in Abidjan, and the space for the construction of the center has already been identified as announced by the Ambassador of the People's Republic of China to Côte d'Ivoire, Wan Li, during a meeting with the press at the premises of the Chinese Chancellery in Abidjan. The cultural center will be a "platform" to bring the Ivorian and Chinese people "to know each other better, to understand each other" in order to strengthen cooperation between the two countries.  On July 27, 2020, the project was reviewed by the Cote d'Ivoire Minister Raymonde Goudou-Coffie and Chinese Ambassador Wan Li. As of this date, no additional information can be found on the implementation status of the project.
justification: Project focuses on cultural exchange and social development without direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Establishment of Chinese Cultural Center for cultural exchange and cooperation between China and Cote d'Ivoire

title: Bank of China provides CFA 53.2 billion loan for Phase 1 of Digital Education Project (Linked to Project ID#91764)
description: On August 31, 2018, the Government of Côte d'Ivoire signed a set of loan agreements with Bank of China for Phase 1 of the Digital Education Project (captured via Project ID#89413 and Project ID#91764) and Phase 1 of the Ministry of Interior and Security Unified Communication System Project (captured via Project ID#89415 and Project ID#92201). According to the Government of Côte d'Ivoire’s Aid Management Platform (AMP), Bank of China signed two loan agreements with the Government of Côte d'Ivoire for Phase 1 of the Digital Education Project: a CFA 53,267,282,421.07 loan agreement (captured via Project ID#89413) and a CFA 8,724,228,100 loan agreement (captured via Project ID#917648). The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the CFA 53,267,282,421.07 loan to finance 85% of the cost of the commercial contract between Huawei and Côte d'Ivoire’s Ministry of National Education and Literacy. It was expected to use the proceeds of the CFA 8,724,228,100 loan to finance 15% of the cost of the commercial contract between Huawei and Côte d'Ivoire’s Ministry of National Education and Literacy.   As of December 2022, the loan had achieved a 104% disbursement rate. 6 disbursements (worth CFA 53,267,282,421.07) had been made under the CFA 53,267,282,421.07 loan: a CFA 3,720,856,102 disbursement on September 30, 2019, a CFA 4,538,584,148 disbursement on March 31, 2020, a CFA 1,060,411,211 disbursement on July 31, 2020, a CFA 6,513,181,062 disbursement on August 31, 2020, a CFA 22,145,589,963 disbursement on June 30, 2021, and a CFA 15,288,659,935.07 disbursement on September 30, 2022. A single disbursement was made under the CFA 8,724,228,100 loan: a CFA 8,743,486,998 disbursement on June 30, 2019.   The goals of the Digital Education Project are to (1) set up a unified communication (VoIP) system for the Ministry of National Education; (2) set up a dedicated data transmission network within the Ministry of National Education; (3) set up a data center for the Ministry of National Education; (4) create multimedia and distance learning rooms in a large network of schools and educational buildings. The ultimate objective of the project is to improve educational equity by expanding access to education in rural and remote areas.  Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. The project officially commenced on March 17, 2020. Then, on June 11, 2021, Mariatou Kone, Côte d'Ivoire’s Minister of National Education and Literacy, attended the inauguration of the data center and multimedia classroom of Abidjan Classical High School. The project has, to date, connected 74 middle schools in 10 cities across the country (Abidjan, Dabou, Grand-Bassam, Yamoussoukro, Bouake, Korhogo, San-Pedro, Odienné, Daloa, and Boundiali) through the installation of video protection, WIFI, multimedia room, e-learning platform, and VDI systems. Unified communication platforms have been deployed to 133 sites (departments, schools, and administrative institutions), effectively creating a next-generation, modern, digital education system for Côte d'Ivoire.   The project has also reportedly resulted in comprehensive, video protection for the physical environment of school campuses, and a unified communications system that has made cross-school interaction and remote collaboration more efficient. Other achievements include: a modular data center that has significantly shortened project deployment time, a unified intelligent management system that has slashed network fault location times from hours to minutes; and an intelligent optimization system that has improved overall network performance by 50%; the establishment of a remote training system, remote interactive classroom capabilities, and an online learning system (so that teachers in remote regions can receive the training they need); the installation of video conference and online video capabilities (so that teachers from all areas of the country can benefit from the experiences and skills of the best teachers in the country); the establishment of multiple training centers to help improve the ICT skills of teachers; the establishment of a remote online learning platform and remote interactive classroom capabilities (to given students access to learning resources anytime and anywhere).
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Côte d'Ivoire e-Education Project. The French project title is L’accès à l’éducation en milieu rural à travers les technologies de la communication or La phase I du Projet d’Education Numérique. The Chinese project title is 智慧教育项目E-education, 国家教育网, or 科特迪瓦国家教育网和国防网项目. 2. The AMP identifies the loan commitment date for both loans as November 9, 2018 rather than August 31, 2018. This issue warrants further investigation.3. Neither Bank of China loan for Phase 1 of the Digital Education Project is included in the Chinese Loans to Africa (CLA) database that is managed by the Global Development Policy Center at Boston University and SAIS-CARI. 4. The AMP system identification number for the CFA 53,267,282,421.07 loan from Bank of China is 1120071329397. The AMP system identification number for the CFA 8,724,228,100 loan from Bank of China is 1120071332414.
combined_text:

Other achievements include: a modular data center that has significantly shortened project deployment time, a unified intelligent management system that has slashed network fault location times from hours to minutes; and an intelligent optimization system that has improved overall network performance by 50%; the establishment of a remote training system, remote interactive classroom capabilities, and an online learning system (so that teachers in remote regions can receive the training they need); the installation of video conference and online video capabilities (so that teachers from all areas of the country can benefit from the experiences and skills of the best teachers in the country); the establishment of multiple training centers to help improve the ICT skills of teachers; the establishment of a remote online learning platform and remote interactive classroom capabilities (to given students access to learning resources anytime and anywhere).
justification: Project focuses on digital education infrastructure and access improvement without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Digital education project, unified communication system, multimedia classrooms, remote learning capabilities, educational equity focus
